lines.text: Never trust a guy that's always smiling. And the man lived in his car!
That's a 50 foot motorhome, George.
Well he doesn't act his age.
Neither do you, George, you act so much older.

[on the no girls allowed club]
You let Gina in the club!
She's vice president.
But Gina's a girl!
She is?
[Gina hits him]
Ow! She don't hit like no girl.
George, I thought you hated tea.
[Stays still for a while]
What is that terrible smell? A dead rat. George, what in the world?
It's gardening food. No, no, it's for planting. It's planting food, it's for gardening. Planting food and gardening.
George, are you all right? I mean lately you've been acting strange and even more more strange than usual.
Nonsense, nonsense!
[Sips the tea which then has a brown spot on his lip while Martha gets grossed out]
Everything is fine.
Martha! I got new spots, and I think there's something wrong with my tongue, see?
[shows her his tongue]
And I got this kink in my back that everytime I do this
[lifts his arm]
everytime I do that it hurts me.
Then don't do that, George those are the same kinks and the same spots you've had for years.
Frogs, lizards, forget the plumber, I need an exterminator.
I'm going to be spending lots of time with Dennis, every minute.
That'll be so much fun. We can go fishing and eat hot dogs in the morning, and stay up really late.
I will not give up. One day, I'll be Mrs. Dennis Mitchell, hmph!
Hey Mister, hurry up.
Shut up, kid, huh?
I pledge allegience, to the flag of the no girls allowed club, and to the coolest club in the universe, one club, invisible, with liberty and justice for guys.
And the heck--
With girls!
Guys, those bugs were fake! I can't believe you fell for them!
Them great big bugs, fake?
That dirty Margaret, she don't fight fair!
We've got to stop her! We have to save Dennis from a fate worse than death!
If I ever find out who he is...
Dennis Mitchell! All the clerks, all the pharmacists, they all know him, they say you're lucky, you could've gone to the hospital.
I was just trying to help.

[groans]
That's what Dennis always says.
